required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Single and Multiple Ascending Dose Study to Assess the Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of CAT-2003
clinical_study.official_title: A Two-Part, Phase 1, Single and Multiple Ascending Dose Study to Assess the Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of CAT-2003 in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This is a two-part Phase 1 placebo-controlled, double-blind, randomized single and multiple ascending dose study. In Part A, CAT-2003 is administered as a single dose; at two doses (1000 and 2000 mg), subjects will return for a second dose of CAT-2003 or placebo after a high fat meal. In Part B, CAT-2003 is administered for 14 consecutive days.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency and severity of adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening to End of study (up to 4 weeks following randomization)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline for hematology, chemistry, coagulation and urinalysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through End of study (up to 4 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline for Physical exams
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through end of study (up to 4 weeks)
Baseline through end of study (up to 4 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in vital signs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through end of study (up to 4 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the pharmacodynamic effects of multiple doses of CAT-2003 on triglycerides and other lipids (LDL-C, VLDL-C, VLDL-triglycerides, non-HDL-C, total cholesterol, HDL-C), apoB, lipoprotein(a), and PCSK9 in healthy subjects with mild dyslipidemia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of study (up to 4 weeks)
